derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: probably from Middle Dutch slobberen 'walk through mud', also 'feed noisily', of imitative origin

entry.def: If a person or an animal slobbers, they let liquid fall from their mouth.

example.tran: 永远都叼着烟头的嘴上流着口水

means.word_mean: 1. let saliva drivel from the mouth;
